page.title: 14BOTHAM'S STORE,NORTH CAVE
page.content: Thirty years ago, Mr. Botham inherited his father's store which is very old. Goods were passed across the counter whereas today the store is self-service. On a Monday orders were collected and made up and flour was in l0 pound bags and sugar was in l00 pound bags. It was ladled out with a shiny scoop that fitted on the scales with individual weights. The bags are all pre-weighed today and costs are calculated on the electric digital machine. During 65 years the coinage has changed too which caused them confusion at first. Earlier for a bill over Â£2.00 you received a dividend stamp. Today the Bothams sell a much greater variety of food including meat but still prefer the days when Mr. Botham delivered goods by bicycle and people chatted across the counter.
